author: GRETCHEN TESKE gteske@qctimes.com
title: Rock Island police arrest shooting suspect Thursday
text: A suspect was arrested by Rock Island police Thursday afternoon, hours after allegedly shooting his co-worker. Dante T. Beard, 30, was arrested after the Rock Island Police Department's Emergency Response Team and Rock Island County Sheriff’s Office Emergency Response Team served a search warrant on Beard who was wanted for aggravated battery with a firearm. Beard was arrested at the American Motor Inn Thursday afternoon, less than three miles from where he allegedly shot a co-worker that morning. Just after 8 a.m., police responded to Pak Source at 690 Mill Street in Rock Island where they found a 34-year-old man with a gunshot wound to his torso. The victim was transported to UnityPoint Health-Trinity Hospital for treatment where his wounds appeared to be serious, but non-life threatening, police announced Thursday morning. People are also reading… There was no update on the victim's condition Thursday afternoon. Police at the scene surmised the victim had a confrontation with his co-worker, Beard, who reportedly pulled out a handgun, shot the victim and left the scene. Beard was arrested just before 1:45 p.m. Thursday and transported to the Rock Island Police Department awaiting transfer to the Rock Island County Jail pending a first court appearance. The incident remains under investigation by the Rock Island Police Department’s Criminal Investigation Division. No further information was available as of Thursday afternoon.
